Comment: This file contains configuration information describing the setup for the evaluation model(s) in each subdirectory.
Each subdirectory to be used should have a key in the dictionary below.
In each scad file, special json blocks will call out the variables that should be evaluated by the user and
changed by the program. Common model configuration parameters which the user can edit are specified in the
EditableConfig block below. the FixedConfig block contains variables fixed across all models and available
both to scad code and for use in JSON blocks.

EditableConfig.Name: XY Deposition/fusion diameter
EditableConfig.Desc: Diameter of the beam size, nozzle, deposition spot size, etc. for the printer (mm)

EditableConfig.Name: Positive XY Gap
EditableConfig.Desc: Minimum gap between positive features in the build plane (mm)

EditableConfig.Name: Negative XY Gap
EditableConfig.Desc: Solid material between negative features in the build plane (mm)

EditableConfig.Name: Positive Z Gap
EditableConfig.Desc: Minimum gap between positive features in the build direction (mm)

EditableConfig.Name: Negative Z Gap
EditableConfig.Desc: Solid material between negative features in the build direction (mm)

EditableConfig.Name: Support Overhangs (0/1)
EditableConfig.Desc: Include support for dangling horizontal members? (1=yes, 0=no)

EditableConfig.Name: Include barcode (0/1)
EditableConfig.Desc: Include a barcode on all generated parts? (1=yes, 0=no)

EditableConfig.Name: Line width for barcode
EditableConfig.Desc: Line width to use for the barcode (mm)

EditableConfig.Name: Barcode Thickness
EditableConfig.Desc: Thickness of the barcode and text blocks (mm)

EditableConfig.Name: Include Text Label (0/1)
EditableConfig.Desc: Include a text identifier on all generated parts? (1=yes, 0=no)

basic.Name: Feature Size Evaluation
basic.Subtitle: Most common evaluation: get information about the smallest features your printer can produce.

angle_interp.Name: Tilt Interpolation Evaluation
angle_interp.Subtitle: Evaluates features at different angles between vertical and horizontal, creating an interpolation that can be used to supplement a Feature Size Evaluation
